com.github.macgregor.alexandria

Class Alexandria

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.Alexandria

  • public class Alexandria
extends Object
    Core class for saving, loading and processing documents. The basic usage is load the state, perform operation: index, convert, sync; generally in that order, save state if necessary, though the operations should handle that for you. An extra save wont hurt. 
     
 Alexandria alexandria = Alexandria.loadContext(".alexandria");
 alexandria.index()
      .convert()
      .syncWithRemote();
 alexandria.save();
    See Also:
    Context, Config, Remote

    • Method Detail

      • index

        public Alexandria index()
                 throws AlexandriaException
        Update the metadata index based on matched files found on the Context.searchPath. Any files found that are not in the list of metadata will be created and added to the list to be later converted and published. Files already in the index that are not found on the search path are marked for deletion from the remote.
        Returns:
        Alexandria instance that with an updated metadata index
        Throws:
        AlexandriaException - wrapper for any exceptions thrown processing the documents
        See Also:
        AlexandriaConvert

      • convert

        public Alexandria convert()
                   throws AlexandriaException
        Convert HTML files from the files in the metadata index. Converted files will be saved to Context.outputPath, if set. Otherwise the files will be converted in place in the same directory as the markdown file being converted. Any exceptions thrown will be collected and thrown after processing all documents.
        Returns:
        Alexandria instance with converted document file paths
        Throws:
        AlexandriaException - wrapper for any exceptions thrown processing the documents

      • syncWithRemote

        public Alexandria syncWithRemote()
                          throws AlexandriaException
        Sync all documents with the configured remote. Creating, updating or deleting as necessary.
        • Create - If the metadata has no Config.DocumentMetadata.remoteUri it is taken as a sign to create a new document. If the document already exists, be sure to manually set the remote uri in the config file to update the exiting document.
        • Update - A checksum of the source document (not the converted html file) is used to determine when to update the remote document. If the checksum calculated at runtime is different than the checksum stored in the metadata index, the remote document is updated.
        • Delete - The index phase will mark metadata index entries that are not found on the search path for deletion in the metadata's Config.DocumentMetadata.extraProps. Once deleted, the extra property flag is removed and the Config.DocumentMetadata.deletedOn field is set which makes all phases essentially ignore it.
        Returns:
        Alexandria instance with updated metadata after the sync
        Throws:
        AlexandriaException - wrapper for any exceptions thrown processing the documents
        See Also:
        AlexandriaIndex, AlexandriaConvert, AlexandriaSync
